faceduck.skeleton.interfaces

Interface World

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    WorldImpl

    public interface World

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add(java.lang.Object newThing, Location loc)
      Adds an object to a location in the world.
      java.util.Set<java.lang.Object> getAllObjects()
      Returns the set of all objects in the world.
      int getHeight()
      Returns the height of the world.
      Location getLocation(java.lang.Object thing)
      Returns the location of a particular object in the world.

      Returns the width of the world.

      Returns true if loc is a valid location in the world, false otherwise.

      boolean step()
      Performs a single step in the simulation.

    • Method Detail

      • getAllObjects

        java.util.Set<java.lang.Object> getAllObjects()
        Returns the set of all objects in the world.
        Returns:
        A set of objects.

      • getLocation

        Location getLocation(java.lang.Object thing)
        Returns the location of a particular object in the world.
        Parameters:
        thing - The object to locate in the world.
        Returns:
        The Location object which contains thing, or null if thing is not in the world.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If thing is null

      • getThing

        java.lang.Object getThing(Location loc)
        Given a location, returns the object which is there or null if no object is at the location
        Parameters:
        loc - The location to investigate
        Returns:
        An Object, or null is the location is empty.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - Throws an exception if loc is null.
        IndexOutOfBoundExcpetion - Throws an exception if loc is out of bounds of the world.

      • add

        void add(java.lang.Object newThing,
         Location loc)
        Adds an object to a location in the world.
        Parameters:
        newThing - The object to add
        loc - The Location to add the object at
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If loc is not empty.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If loc or newThing are null.
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If loc is out of bounds in the world.

      • remove

        void remove(java.lang.Object oldThing)
        Given an object in the world, this method will remove that object from the world.
        Parameters:
        oldThing - The object to remove from the world.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If oldThing is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If oldThing is not in the world.

      • getWidth

        int getWidth()
        Returns the width of the world.
        Returns:
        An integer representing the width of the world.

      • getHeight

        int getHeight()
        Returns the height of the world.
        Returns:
        An integer representing the height of the world.

      • step

        boolean step()
        Performs a single step in the simulation.
        Returns:
        Returns false if there are no faceduck.actors to step, true otherwise.

      • isValidLocation

        boolean isValidLocation(Location loc)
        Returns true if loc is a valid location in the world, false otherwise.
        Parameters:
        loc - the location to inspect
        Returns:
        true if loc is valid in the world, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If loc is null.
